column4: I am having a problem with bluetooth.  I want to transfer a file over to my device, and it does not support ubuntu's "Send file to device..." option.  I then tried to copy it over using the file browser, and it won't let me.  How can I get around this?
can you use your device to scan your PC and find the file?
your computer's bluetooth see the phone?
yes. it can.  I have been copying pictures and videos from the phone.
that would be frustrating to want to go the other way and it doesn't....
it is.  is there any way to be able to copy them over?
last resort would be a usb-type cable... not sure about other ways...
sorry I don't have something more to offer...
you mean the phone says that?
perhaps obexpushd could be of help - I have no experience
I'll look into it.  Thank you :)
Very very thank you!  It made the "Send file to device..." option work with my phone!
